Manx: (In drawing attention to the BON MARCHE, which term literally means) Good Market, a place where almost everything can be bought, the best of its kind, and at the lowest price (and as I am determined that every person may distinctly understand the meaning of BON MARCHE, I hereby give it in the Manx language:—)
English: Margey Mie, yn boayl raad ta bunnys dy chooilley red er ny chreck, yn chooid share jeh y cheint, as ec yn feagh s’inshley
